alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 6:45PM MST until February 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 5 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches at pass level, and up to 18 inches above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 12 and 25 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 AM Sunday to 5 PM MST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
